item.title: Coop using pavement to store bins and collection items, 11th September
item.description:
His problem was first reported over six months ago, but the Council has still not addressed it. The Co-op on the corner of Mill Street continues to use the pavement as an extension of the store. Trolleys filled with cardboard and recyclable goods are left outside each day. The situation becomes worse at night when foxes rummage through the items after the store has closed. I kindly request that the Council take action to resolve this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Mill Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown shrubbery to rear fences of Brook Street, houses that back onto park, 11th September
item.description:
My house on Brook Street backs onto Northumberland Heath Recreation Ground. The shrubbery between the park and my rear fence is extremely overgrown and encroaching into our property and on to the top of our garden shed. When the hedge was recently lopped, damage has been caused to the rear of our garden shed where the operator of the tractor was probably not able to visualise our shed behind it. The shed has been repaired today by your contractor but this damage is likely to happen again. We require this hedge to be cut back thoroughly, cleared of all debris and pulled away from our fence, to prevent any future incidents occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, The Drive, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
